page.title: 04HUNTING,PORK PIES & CHEESE
page.content:
Melton Mowbray has been a famous hunting centre since the early 19th century and has been visited by nobility & gentry during the hunting season. There are many of the old hunting lodges still left in the town although they have been put to new uses.
Traditionally Hunt Cake is eaten at a hunt. The cake is still made at the bakers Dickinson & Morris' in Nottingham Street,Melton Mowbray.
Melton is also famous for its pork pies & Stilton cheese. Both are still made in and around the town today.
Each December there is a Fatstock Show in the town where prizes are awarded for the best cheeses and pies.
